lead_paragraph: Four months after Portland defenseman Jordan Smith lost his left eye after he was hit by a puck, the American Hockey League yesterday became the second minor hockey league to require face protection for all players. The league's board of governors voted overwhelmingly to require protective visors, which are mandatory in the East Coast Hockey League. Face protection is also required for college players. Smith was hit in the eye by a deflected puck on Feb. 24 in a game against the Manchester Monarchs. The injury was so severe his eye had to be removed, and he now has a prosthesis.
